paper.title: Are tableaux an improvement on truth-tables?

author.org: Department of Computing, Imperial College, London, U.K.

paper.venue: Journal of Logic, Language and Information
paper.abstract: We show that Smullyanu0027s analytic tableaux cannot p-simulate the truth-tables. We identify the cause of this computational breakdown and relate it to an underlying semantic difficulty which is common to the whole tradition originating in Gentzenu0027s sequent calculus, namely the dissonance between cut-free proofs and the Principle of Bivalence. Finally we discuss some ways in which this principle can be built into a tableau-like method without affecting its “analytic” nature.
